abstract: A federal court judge dealt a blow to Johnson & Johnson in its $5.5 billion lawsuit over the sale of Guidant to Boston Scientific, dismissing some claims and only allowing part of the case to proceed. The ruling, which was made public on Thursday, throws out the case against Abbott Laboratories but allows J&J to go ahead with its claim against Guidant for breach of contract.
lead_paragraph: A federal court judge dealt a blow to Johnson & Johnson in its $5.5 billion lawsuit over the sale of Guidant to Boston Scientific, dismissing some claims and only allowing part of the case to proceed. The ruling, which was made public on Thursday, throws out the case against Abbott Laboratories but allows J&J to go ahead with its claim against Guidant for breach of contract.

headline.main: Court Deals Blow to J&J Suit Over Guidant Sale
